episodes.title: Exposing Jehovah's Witness Shunning: True Crime New Zealand
episodes.description:
In this episode, we feature an insightful interview with Anusha Bradley, an investigative journalist from Radio New Zealand, who will be leading a panel discussion at the Decult Cult Awareness Conference discussing Jehovah's Witness shunning a practice they are known for globally. We dive into Anusha's deep investigation into the emotional abu5e caused by shunning practices within the Jehovah's Witnesses, a widespread issue. #EmotionalAbuse #Shunning #JehovahsWitnesses

Get your Livestream ticket here:
https://events.humanitix.com/decult-cult-awareness-conference-tickets 

During the conversation, Anusha also delves into the ongoing New Zealand investigation into abuse in care within the Jehovah's Witnesses, an investigation the religion tried to halt by filing a lawsuit. Their attempt to avoid scrutiny only raises further suspicions. #AbuseInCare #ReligiousAbuse #NZInvestigation #JehovahsWitnessLawsuit

This episode is part of the Decult Cult Awareness Conference channel take over where we introduce you to a number of the leading speakers at Decult. Anusha Bradley will lead a panel alongside former Jehovah's Witnesses, including myself, host and director of Witness Underground documentary. We explore the dark realities of high-control groups and how these investigations are critical to holding organizations accountable. #Decult #CultAwareness #WitnessUnderground #HighControlGroups

The results of this groundbreaking investigation are expected to be revealed soon. Don't miss this opportunity to hear these important discussions by grabbing your live stream ticket today! Tickets are just $100 NZD or $65 USD. #DecultConference #InvestigativeJournalism #Accountability #ReligiousInvestigations

Make sure to support the conversation, help spread awareness, and secure your ticket to the live stream of the Decult Conference! #Decult2024 #LiveStreamEvent #CultSurvivorStories #ReligiousFreedom #ExJW

We just had an excellent screening of Witness Underground with Cine Movil, a cultural revolution cinema program in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico. We previously had our international premiere of Witness Underground here with Cine Movil. The host invited us back for another very special screening now that the film is in wide release.

Witness Underground highlights an indie music culture that emerged inside of a religous cult. In this captivating 4-minute video, we dive into the secretive and fascinating world of Nuclear Gopher, a safe space for kids, waiting for armageddon. This bizarre situation, inspired a community of artists, including Ryan Sutter, one of the main characters in our award winning feature documentary, Witness Underground.

Genres:
Social Impact Documentary, Cult, Documentary | Arts and Culture, 
Social Issues, Music and Performances, Informational & Educational, Music Documentary

Short Synopsis:
Witness Underground is a documentary that reveals the insular DIY artist community that emerged within a religious cult in Minneapolis. Music, fame, and success are typically forbidden in this group, which instructs its members to “beware of independent thinking.”

The artists at the heart of the music scene have their faith tested. They battle for mental health and push the boundaries of their religion’s norms, where leaving means being banned from interacting with your entire family and social circle for life.

Although severely restricted, they create the record label Nuclear Gopher and produced over 30 albums of earnest and personal music that spans: singer/songwriter, riot grrrl, psychedelic rock, pop, EDM, shoegaze, and post-rock. Carefully curated performances punctuate their stories of friendship, deep loss, and personal growth.

Long Pitch:
In suburban Minneapolis, upstanding Jehovah’s Witnesses are arriving home after hours of doorbell ringing and front doors slamming.

But not Cindy, or the elder staring down this teenager.
Or the man she lost her virginity to hours ago in a hotel.

“Did you start it? Did you touch him?”, the elder asks.

“Did you have an orgasm?”

She played a show that week. A coffee shop Witnesses flocked to.

She plucked strings to her pop-punk anthem.
She belted out the words her spirit had tried to hide.
Her "Prayer To No One" ricocheted off the walls to a riveted crowd.

They wanted an encore.
She knew a private punishment wasn’t going to be enough.
She went back for more.

Witness Underground unveils an unexplored music community surviving within a dystopia. Humanizing the struggle, courage, and artistry of former members.

From home-brew music videos to grand pop-up festivals over 17 years and 30 albums. Art becomes more than self-expression; it is awakening, healing, and freedom from their trauma. "Frequently searing and undeniably confrontational.” [Tone Madison Music Magazine]

Long Synopsis:
A chilling, yet empowering social impact documentary, Witness Underground highlights the music and defection of doomsday cult members and the consequences of self-expression. A “unique look, with unwavering access, inside the complexities of faith, and the bond forged between artists.” [Amir George, Film and Art Programmer, True/False Film Festival.] 

Nuclear Gopher, an underground indie record label, arose within their dystopia as a safe space for a few hundred born-in artists to express themselves. Witness the history of their most prolific underground bands as they navigated in the shadows of a high-control society. 

From homebrew music videos to pop-up music festivals this community created earnest, multi-genre, secular music, as a means of waking up, and processing trauma. "Frequently searing and undeniably confrontational" [Tone Madison] As outcasts they expose the losses of community and family. Their music is more than just an outlet for self-expression but a powerful tool to heal.

episodes.title: Inside the Mind of a Cult Expert - Decult takeover - Ulrike Schiesser
episodes.description:
Our expert guest offers practical advice for those affected by cults and how to communicate with loved ones trapped inside. Witness Underground Podcast ft. Austrian cult expert, Ulrike Schiesser. In our Decult takeover series of Witness Underground Podcast we support the Decult Cult Awareness Conference. She highlights what she plans to discuss in-depth at the upcoming Decult Cult Awareness Conference. This interview will wet your appetite for the powerful education and passionate advocacy she will bring to Decult.

Austrian cult expert and professional skeptic, Ulrike Schiesser, has dedicated her life to cult awareness, supporting former cult members through her private practice, and has been highlighted across Europe as a respected public voice of reason, in a world increasingly difficult to make sense of. You're going to love her!

Crowdfunding:
Support New Zealand documentary professionals to capture of the Decult conference as a documentary:
https://www.boosted.org.nz/projects/decult-documentary 

Decult Cult Awareness Conference:
https://decult.net

In this special installment of our Decult Takeover series, we sit down with the renowned cult expert and skeptic, Ulrike Schiesser. Join your host, Scott Homan, as we explore Ulrike's extensive knowledge and experiences working with one of the premiere goverment funded organizations in central Europe.

Buy her book: Facts and Predjudice
https://a.co/d/6vKQup5

Where she works in Vienna, Austria: Federal Office for Cult Affaires
https://bundesstelle-sektenfragen.at

Ulrike Schiesser is a psychologist and psychotherapist working at the Federal Office for Cult Affaires (Bundesstelle für Sektenfragen) an Austrian state-run office who deals with cults and various problematic developments in the field of esotericism, personality cults, authoritarian and monopolizing group structures and conspiracy theories. She does counseling of family members of conspiracy affiliated persons and public stakeholders and accompanies people through rethinking and change processes.

In support of the speakers at the Decult Cult Awareness Conference, where both Ulrike Schiesser and I have been invited to speak, this episode offers a unique opportunity to understand the psychological and sociological aspects of coercive groups to help you to recognize the signs of cult influence, the psychological manipulation tactics used by these groups, and the paths to recovery for former members.

🌟 Highlights of this episode:

Ulrike Schiesser's role in helping others recognize these complex groups.
How to communicate with those who are trapped by these manipulative tactics.
Practical advice for those affected by cults.
How to communicate with affected loved ones.

🔔 Like, comment, and subscribe to Witness Underground for more episodes of the Decult Takeover series and stay informed about our participation in the Decult Cult Awareness Conference.

#WitnessUnderground #Decult #CultAwareness #UlrikeSchiesser #ScottHoman #Podcast #CultExpert #Skeptic #CultRecovery #MentalHealth

episodes.title: End Stigma! Doctor Caroline Ansley Centrepoint Restoration Project
episodes.description:
Join us for an illuminating episode of the Witness Underground takeover series in support of the Decult Cult Awareness Conference. Co-host of Cult Chat Podcast, Doctor Caroline Ansley, a Christchurch New Zealand-based medical doctor, and the visionary founder of the Centrepoint Restoration Project. Dr. Ansley, a child survivor of the Centrepoint cult, has dedicated her life to supporting former cult members and their families through her community and website.

In this episode, we dive into Dr. Ansley's journey from surviving a cult to becoming a prominent activist and medical professional. We explore her work with the Centrepoint Restoration Project, her role as a co-host of Cult Chat, and her passionate advocacy for cult awareness and support for ex-members.

Key discussion points include:

Dr. Ansley's Background and Activism: Discover how her experiences as a child survivor shaped her path and inspired the creation of the Centrepoint Restoration Project.

Medical Perspective on Cults: Learn about the crucial insights doctors and medical staff need when working with cult leavers, and why this knowledge is essential for effective support and healing.

Decult - Cult Awareness Conference: Understand why this event is vital for New Zealand and Dr. Ansley's involvement in raising awareness about the dangers of cults and coercive control.

Global and Local Perspectives: Discuss the significance of cult awareness on a global scale, and why even a small island nation like New Zealand plays a pivotal role in addressing these issues globally.

Changing Perceptions: Explore Dr. Ansley's vision for changing the way society views current and former cult members, and the importance of ending the stigma surrounding them.

Support and Resources: Highlight the need for better therapy, social justice, and support systems for cult survivors, and the efforts being made to develop professional skills and rally community support.

Dr. Ansley's work is a beacon of hope and resilience, demonstrating the power of community and the importance of addressing cult-related issues with compassion and understanding. Tune in to gain a deeper insight into the Centrepoint Restoration Project, the challenges faced by cult survivors, and the ongoing efforts to create a safer and more informed society.

Don't miss this compelling conversation where we explore the complexities of cult dynamics, the journey to recovery, and the collective efforts needed to make a real difference.

Join this channel to get access to perks:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnXbnuEB0iwtpY_Dl_Q9KdA/join

episodes.title: Decult Cult Awareness Conference & New Documentary - Boosted Campaign
episodes.description:
Decult Cult Awareness Conference & New Documentary. Check out the Live Campaign!

https://www.boosted.org.nz/projects/decult-documentary

Australasia will host its first ever cult awareness conference in October. Tickets, newsletter and info: https://www.decult.net

Experts and survivors will meet in Christchurch to highlight how cults work, and the harm they cause.

The conference is called Decult, and is being organised by journalist and author of Cult Trip: Inside the World of Coercion and Control, Anke Richter, an Author, reporter and cult researcher.

The Aim:
Decult 2024 is a pioneering conference that addresses the pervasive harm inflicted by high-control groups in New Zealand. By giving cult survivors a voice and bringing experts from various fields together, they’re creating a unique opportunity for mental health professionals, government departments, law enforcement and first responders to offer better support and prevent cultic harm in the future. The aim is to develop lasting networks for professionals and to present ongoing events. More cult awareness will improve the wellbeing of vulnerable individuals.

The Conference:
Spend a weekend with authors and educators, academics and counsellors, survivors and their advocates as they share their expertise and personal stories. Decult is for anyone interested in spirituality, religion or personal growth who wants to engage in respectful discussion to broaden their knowledge – especially health professionals and frontline services helping cult victims: How does recruitment work, what are the signs of coercive control, how can people get out, and how can they recover?

Regardless of their background, faith or belief system, attendees will leave with a deeper understanding of harmful dynamics in cult-like groups and how to support cult leavers better. This thought-provoking event will be a forum for those who left their communities to connect with others and feel heard and seen. Let’s show them that we care.

The Documentary:
Award-winning film makers Robyn Jordaan and Caleb MacDonald have an ambitious plan to create a documentary about the Decult 2024 Conference in October. As this is the first cult awareness conference of its kind in Australasia, they’re creating a resource that can long outlive the conference. 

Their film will include interviews with our speakers – authors, educators, counsellors, academics and survivors – sharing their expertise and personal stories. It is our hope that audiences will gain a deeper understanding of harmful dynamics in cult-like groups, how to prevent them, and how to support cult leavers better. 

This amount will allow them to produce a 20-30 minute documentary which showcases the conference and also features interviews with speakers and survivors.

The funding goal allows us to cover the basic costs of creating the documentary and recaps (transport, filming, production tasks, marketing fees). The stretch goal will provide additional creative support for the conference and the Decult Charitable Trust.

Don’t have the ability to contribute? You could consider spreading the word. Share this link: https://www.boosted.org.nz/projects/decult-documentary

Check out the Decult website founded by renouned author of Cult Trip, Anke Richter. https://www.decult.net

Cult Recovery Conference & Training

DECULT 2024 is a ground-breaking cult awareness conference with international experts, cult survivors and victim advocates to address a critical gap and reduce harm. We’re especially inviting psychologists, therapists and counsellors. Keynote speaker Dr Gillie Jenkinson, a UKCP accredited psychotherapist specialising  in coercive control, religious trauma and group-based abuse, will offer additional two- and five-day workshops in post-cult recovery for mental health professionals after the Decult conference. This is a first in NZ.

Join us on October 19-20, 2024, in Christchurch, where journalists, authors, and cult researchers like Anke Richter will delve into the insidious workings of high-control groups.

Decult 2024 aims to shed light on the lasting harm caused by cults. Survivors and experts will convene to share stories and insights, empowering mental health professionals, law enforcement, and frontline responders to better assist those affected by coercive control.

The conference promises a weekend of learning and connection, featuring renowned speakers like Dr. Gillie Jenkinson, a psychotherapist specializing in cult recovery. Dive into topics such as recruitment tactics, signs of control, and pathways to recovery.

The documentary will capture the essence of Decult 2024 to amplify survivor voices and educate audiences on identifying and supporting victims of cultic abuse.

Join the movement to combat cultic harm. Consider supporting the documentary campaign. Together, we can raise awareness and promote healing for survivors of coercive groups.

Gnostic teachings about Yahweh, Jesus, Satan vs Jehovah Witness. Which god is YHWH in the biblical Jewish pantheon? One of the core teachings of Gnostics is that the god that christians actually worship, is... well you know what, I don't know. That's why Emmanuel Goldstein [1984 Orwell fame] is coming on to reveal what he was raised to believe, from a modern gnostic perspective. 

He's a facinating guy!

https://emmanuelgoldstein1984.substack.com

Check out his channel before the live stream. Consider subscribing:

Tubi TV Witness Underground
https://tubitv.com/movies/100018684/witness-underground

Prepare to join me with our esteemed guest, Emmanuel Goldstein. Hailing from a Gnostic upbringing in Germany, Goldstein brings a unique perspective shaped by his lived experience with gnostic teachings. Join us as we delve into his experiences and insights, challenging conventional beliefs about Christianity and the worship of YHWH in the biblical Jewish pantheon.

Intriguingly, Goldstein was led to believe that all mainstream Christians adhere to extremist ideologies akin to the cult I once belonged to—a misconception that we'll explore. Central to Gnostic teachings is the notion that the deity worshipped by Christians may not be as straightforward as it seems. Goldstein tantalizingly hints at revelations regarding this concept that intriugued me. He promises to shed light on the true nature of the god Christians worship and revelations about what he actually discovered and why he reached out to me.

In anticipation of this discussion, we invite you to explore Emmanuel Goldstein's channel for a glimpse into his thought-provoking perspectives. episodes.title: Phenomenon of High Control Religion - UK Cult Hackers Podcast
episodes.description:
UK Cult Hackers Podcast co-host, joins Witness Underground to do a retrospective look at "season one" with 267 episodes! Explore the phenomenon of High Control religion. We're diving into what organizational psychologist, Stephen Mather, has learned from hosting 267 episodes with former cult members, and cult experts around the world, with deep journalistic and academic integrity.

Dive in with Witness Underground as we uncover the intriguing world of global cults, exploring cults in America and the UK, guided by none other than Stephen Mather, the host of the acclaimed UK podcast, Cult Hackers.

Cult Hackers Podcast has always been about trying to understand the phenomenon of cults and High Control, as well as listen to people’s stories. Stephen is an activist against any one particular group. His goal is to understand the psychological processes at work and help people understand what happens, as well as think about how people make sense of their lives after they leave.

He's hoping to start a PhD this year to get even deeper into the processes at work behind the cult and high control phenomenon on the rise. 

In this episode, I interview the host of Cult Hackers Podcast, Stephen Mather, an organizational psychologist. He delves into the complex dynamics of cults, based on 267 episodes that he and his co-host Celine Mather, his daughter, conducted in what they are calling, "season one" of Cult Hackers. 12+ episodes for a season is typical. 267 episodes is next level! Delve into the psychological dynamics behind these groups with insights from an organizational psychologist. 

Stephen Mather spent a lot of his adult life, and in Cult Hackers, exploring the complexity of personal identity for new leavers, those who have exited a cult recently. The cult told members who you are and what your is or was. At this point in your life you need to form your own identity. That topic is deeply fascinating to me and essential for everyone. We'll get into the topic of behavior and identity guiding you to the authentic you.

From chilling tales of cults in America and UK to the lesser-known groups emerging today in many countries, witness gripping accounts of the scariest cults in America and gain insight into church cults which we will reveal on the show. Stephen is cult expert with a personal background one global high-control cult.

Stephen and Celine have been excellent partners in helping to get the cult documentary "Witness Underground" out into wide release with the unique global outreach throughout 2023 and we'll dive into documentaries on cults 2023 and 2024. This video offers real stories that will leave you captivated. 

Whether you're a fan of cult podcasts or simply curious about the high control phenomenon, don't miss out on this enlightening exploration with an expert. Subscribe now for the best insights into cults, hosted by the one and only, Stephen Mather!

From the origins of the religion to its modern-day implications, 'Witness Underground | Escaping a Cult' offers a comprehensive understanding of the Jehovah Witness community from the inside, through the profoundly powerful music of active members. episodes.title: This woman was interrogated and abused by cult leaders
episodes.description:
This woman was interrogated by cult leaders. Female Hollywood writer, actor, director, Bonnie Root, explores the system of manipulation, abuse, and control in the Jehovah Witnesses and the film industry. We dive into her experience with a cult Judicial Committee, sexual interrogations, her award-winning film, "Sissy" about grooming of teens, The Movie, a physchological thriller, and her new ExJW film coming out, Diary of Heather Keating, a narrative exposing the Judicial Committee for the abuse common in the Jehovah's Witness system of punishment. 

Share your experience with the community in the comments!

We met because my Witness Underground documentary and her film, THE MOVIE, both played at GenreBlast Film Festival. The director, Michael Mandell, approached me after seeing Witness Underground to let me know that Bonnie Root, the star actor in his film, THE MOVIE, was also a former Jehovah's Witness. I invited her to our California film premiere in Los Angeles at the Filmocracy Film Festival. A bunch of ExJW's showed up and we've been in touch ever since. 

I'm so excited to be able to share her amazing work with you!

In this gripping narrative directed by Bonnie Root, a prominent female director in Hollywood, the harrowing realities of religious oppression and manipulation come to light. Her experience being interrogated and abused by cult leaders has shaped much of her life and empowered her to expose this religion for what it really is, a dangerous manipulative control cult. Her films delve into the depths of cruelty within religious processes, highlighting the systemic violations of women's rights.

This woman's journey unfolds as she faces offensive religious interrogations and manipulative control tactics by the Jehovah Witnesses' judicial committee. Through Root's lens, we witness the profound impact of the system of manipulation, abuse, and control within this organization.

"Diary of Heather Keating," scripted by Root, promises a raw exploration of narcissistic abuse within the context of religious communities. Root's previous work on "Sissy" has established her as a formidable force in shedding light on sensitive topics, particularly the destructive form of grooming common in this cult.

She confronts the reality of women's rights violations and the insidious nature of religious oppression processes. Experience the power of storytelling to expose the truth to ignite global awareness and change.

🎬 👁️‍🗨 In her gripping psychological thriller, The Movie, Bonnie Root, who once endured the negative experiences of an abusive cult, the Jehovah's Witnesses, takes us on a journey through the real inspiration behind horror. Join us as she shares profound insights into the parallel themes of abuse, drawing from her own life experiences.

🔍 Bonnie Root's portrayal as a Hollywood actress mirrors the haunting realities of her past. Discover the chilling narrative of a repairman tormenting a washed-up actress in her own home, echoing the psychological trauma she endured within the confines of the abusive Jehovah's Witnesses cult.

episodes.title: What motivates religious activism? How can you get involved? [ExJW]

What motivates religious activism? How can you get involved? [ExJW] Apostate Weekly & Former2Free show host James Winner and director of the documentary Witness Underground discuss the deep motivations behind cult and religious activism and how you can help your favorite channel(s) in a meaningful way.

- Resources discussed are added below -

We dive into our original and sustaining reasons for our religious activism on Apostate Weekly, Former2Free and Witness Underground channels. We explore the intricate motivations driving individuals to become activists within religious communities, with a particular focus on the Jehovah's Witness cult.

Joining me is none other than James Winner, the show co-host for both Apostate Weekly and host of Former2Free YouTube channels. Alongside him is Scott Homan, the director of the documentary "Witness Underground" and the extension, the XJW Coming Out series, and the Witness Underground Podcast on the Witness Underground YouTube channel.

Together, James and Scott candidly unravel the layers of their personal and emotional motivations that led them to initiate their channels and Scott's ambitious film.

In this dynamic conversation, the duo also addresses the significance of religion in society and the role of activism in shedding light on religious practices. They explore the meanings of apostasy and apostate, encouraging viewers to support the apostasy movement, join the growing community of ExJWs, and engage in compelling discussions about leaving Jehovah's Witnesses.

This episode serves as a call to action, urging the ExJW community to come together and support one another through an engaging education project. James and Scott emphasize the importance of backing channels that resonate with you before taking the plunge into creating your own. It's not just an interview – it's a rallying cry for collective empowerment and a reminder that everyone has a role to play in the journey towards understanding and liberation.

Get involved, join the conversation, and be a part of the movement towards enlightenment and support within the ExJW community. Don't miss out on this insightful discussion that promises to inspire and ignite change.

SYNOPSIS:
Sissy is a fourteen year old girl living on the streets to escape her dysfunctional home. Her mother, addicted to good-for-nothing men but carrying some guilt about her daughter's situation, has a plan. She arranges for Sissy to go on the road with "Uncle Charlie," a struggling, unstable magician headed out on a two-bit tour through Nevada. When the trip begins to deteriorate, so does Charlie. This leaves Sissy even more isolated than she was when she was all alone, and forces her to find the strength she never knew she had.

Sissy, and our full interview, reveal the true life story of her teenage years. Gain a deeper understanding of the film's inspiration, rooted in her experience as an abuse victim within the Jehovah's Witnesses and a resulting dysfunctional home. This film addresses the abuse horror stories that often go untold, the complexities of leaving the Jehovah Witness religion and the courage it takes to share such a personal narrative with the world.

Sissy is a powerful testament to resilience and strength. Don't miss this thought-provoking exploration into abuse, grooming, and survival.

episodes.title: Asheville AVL Film director - Audio Engineer at AuxBus - Libsyn
episodes.description: Ryan DuVal, software engineer and old friend from Colorado, was the only person I asked to help produce Witness Underground. He flew up from Asheville North Carolina as our producer in Minneapolis and was the guiding light for multiple editing revisions.He brought a fresh perspective to the project that became essential in telling this deep nuanced story. This episode was recorded at the Auxbus podcast studio in Asheville, a start-up where he pioneered the audio software we recorded this on. He interviews me and my personal back story for the first time.  (Auxbus was later bought by Libsyn and his software is their trademark audio editing software for their podcast  distribution company). This was recorded on the heals of our production together, and after story-lock in our documentary post-production phase. He had a huge hand in the production influencing the story, and pulling out many valuable moments across our interviews. He also ran sound, wrote interview questions, and asked the interview questions, co-directing the storytelling.  He also ran second camera for interviews, live performance music videos, and also some of the side stories that made it into the film, among many additional roles that we shared. He was essential in the creation of this film.  Enjoy this episode as he digs into my back story and the creation of this film, the XJW Coming Out series, and this podcast.Thanks Ryan!Watch now:http://WitnessUnderground.comWatch & Support:https://vimeo.com/ondemand/witnessundergroundhttps://Patreon.com/WitnessUndergroundhttps://YouTube.com/@WitnessUndergroundStore:https://witness-underground-cult-documentary-release.pledgebox.com/preorderJump into our Discordhttps://discord.gg/WUp9c95rsXReach out directly: XJWdoc@gmail.com-Scott

During production of Witness Underground documentary, we took a break between interviews and shooting, to have a former Jehovah's Witness meetup in Minneapolis. We ended up shooting these additional short interviews in the backyard during the event for the XJW Coming Out series as a bonus episode.

Three short interviews capture the diverse experiences of individuals who found the courage to question their upbringing in this "Apocalyptic cult" and, in doing so, discovered the strength to forge their own paths.

Listen to three former Witnesses, Jesse America, Erica Rae, and James Zimmerman who got out. They all describe what life was like inside, pressures they experienced, why they left, and their new world views. 

They dive into how they feel about this group looking back into their strange past.

Topics discussed:
Cognitive dissonance, conflict caused by religion, inner feelings as a witness, cultural norms within the cult, mis-education, becoming open-minded, disconnection with organized religion, different way to believe in god, atheism, enjoying life now rather than waiting on a higher power, reconnecting with grandparents and other family that were disconnected from because of this religions intolerance of non-members. Being honest about reality, achieving contentment in life through community, life passions, bond through powerful friendships. Family strength, success through education, first in family history to get a degree, feeling of freedom and access to pursue passions, showing love without judgement towards others.

Untethered from authoritarian control what did you do with your freedom?

Are you happier now?

What do you do now with your life?

In this compelling episode, we sit down with Gina Brown, Christopher of the band Scifidelic and Writer Brie Yarbrough in discussion with Scott Homan, Director of the award winning and eye-opening documentary "Witness Underground," which sheds light on artists who escaped a cult.

Together, we delve deep into their unique perspectives on shunning, drawing from their diverse experiences. We explore the profound impact of music, art, therapy, movement, and meditation as coping mechanisms during their time in the cult and as tools for healing after leaving.

Prepare to be inspired as we explore their creative endeavors, from dance and acting to crafting a new Streaming Series pitch and building on a successful TikTok channel. We'll also uncover the intriguing story behind their decades-long music project called Scifidelic, featuring a band member known as Caustic, who was once a high-ranking member at the world headquarters of the Jehovah's Witnesses. Discover how their music directly addresses the themes of faith and exiting from it.

Our guest, Gina, shares details about her exciting project—a series about the complexities of love, where an unlikely couple comes together amidst their vastly different worlds. Having experienced trauma within the Jehovah's Witness community, Gina incorporates her personal journey into the script, exploring the challenges of same-sex relationships and the harmful influence of the faith. We'll also touch upon the harrowing experiences of her sister-in-law, who faced life-threatening complications during childbirth due to the cult's ban on blood transfusions.

Additionally, we discuss Brie's upcoming book, which inspired her escape from the cult and provided solace and courage during her challenging journey. 

Together, we explore strategies for overcoming triggers, dealing with attachment, and addressing past baggage. Moreover, we delve into the diverse interpretations of the cult's teachings regarding the end of the world and the impact it had on our guests' lives.

Join us for this thought-provoking conversation that unveils the power of art, resilience, and self-discovery. Get ready to expand your consciousness and embark on a journey of inspiration and empowerment.
